Strength. The higher the number, the more damage you inflict.
Magical power. Increases ward and spell damage.
Fighting skill. A higher number improves accuracy.
This affects both evasion and attack speed.
Reduces damage from weapons.
Reduces damage from magical attacks.
Luck affects accuracy and avoid.
The distance you can cross in one turn.
Constitution. Affects how well the unit can wield heavier weapons.
Who is this unit rescuing?
Determines bonuses given to other units in supports.
Determines bonuses given to other units in supports.
Holistic combat rating.
Fatigue. A unit whose fatigue exceeds its limit cannot be deployed.
Amount of damage this weapon causes. Affected by defenses.
Chance that the attack will hit. Affected by terrain and enemies.
Weapon Range. A range of 1 can only hit adjacent spaces.
Ability to dodge enemy attacks. Affects enemy's accuracy.
Attack Speed. If a unit has 4 or more attack speed than its opponent, it attacks twice.
Chance the weapon will strike a critical blow, dealing extra damage.
Unit level. How experienced a unit is.
Experience points gained. Gain 100 points to earn a new level.
Hit points. The unit is removed from the battle if HP reaches 0.

No additional changes to enemies. Play this if you want average challenge.

Player unit's Growths boosted by 100%. Easier to play through when testing.

Level ups are random, but odds for a stat to grow increase with each LV up miss.

Guard Gauge. When paired up, every attack given or recieved increases the gauge by 2. At 10-10, block the next upcoming attack.
